bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 27, 1898

div1.p: Lazear wishes Sweitzer a nice trip to New York, and informs her they haven't found a house yet.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 27, 1898
div1.p:
Your letter of
Aug 24 has reached
me. I hope you
are having cooler
weather by this time
and I hope you are
feeling better.

I suppose Uncle Tom
is now at Windsor.
I shall try to get
out there soon.

I hope you will have
a nice trip to New York. The
theatres and concerts have not
began. I wonder it they still
have concerts at Brighton Beach.
It was reported that Boston
Symphony was not coming here
this winter but they have decided
to come, I am glad to say.
I have not yet found a house.
I shall have to search in
earnest before long.

Mabel finds it cool at Yarmouth.
Mrs. Houston and Nellie are
well.
